docs.snippet: The Serie A season kicks off on Saturday with Italian football at a new low following a miserable World Cup campaign and the election of a federation president embroiled in a racism row.
docs.lead_paragraph: The Serie A season kicks off on Saturday with Italian football at a new low following a miserable World Cup campaign and the election of a federation president embroiled in a racism row.

headline.main: Italy Under a Cloud for Serie A Kickoff

docs.snippet: People in Uruguay who want to grow their own marijuana at home were able to register to do so Wednesday as the government launched the latest phase in its first-of-its-kind legalization program.

headline.main: Uruguayans Can Now Sign Up to Grow Pot at Home
headline.print_headline: Uruguayans Can Now Sign Up to Grow Pot at Home

docs.snippet: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner’s suggestion to consider making Santiago del Estero the nation’s capital reflects longstanding tension between Buenos Aires and Argentina’s provinces.
docs.lead_paragraph: President Cristina Fernández de Kirchner’s suggestion to consider making Santiago del Estero the nation’s capital reflects longstanding tension between Buenos Aires and Argentina’s provinces.
docs.abstract: Argentinian President Cristina Fernandez de Kirchner’s suggestion to consider making Santiago del Estero the nation’s capital reflects longstanding tension between Buenos Aires and Argentina’s provinces, where most of country's agricultural and mineral wealth is generated.

headline.main: Proposing New Capital Is Old Idea in Argentina
headline.print_headline: Proposing New Capital Is Old Idea in Argentina

byline.contributor: Jonathan Gilbert contributed reporting from Montevideo, Uruguay.

docs.snippet: Five-set matches take an unnecessary toll on the bodies of male tennis players at Grand Slams, and they also perpetuate inequality between the men and the women.
docs.lead_paragraph: Five-set matches take an unnecessary toll on the bodies of male tennis players at Grand Slams, and they also perpetuate inequality between the men and the women.
docs.abstract: Juliet Macur Sports of The Times column contends that tennis Grand Slam events, like the United States Open, should consider shortening men’s possible five-setters to a maximum of three, which is format for most men’s tournaments other than Grand Slam events, the Davis Cup and the Olympic final; holds that best-of-three rule would spare men from trying to push themselves beyond what is most of the time necessary.

headline.main: Aching for Change in an Unequal Sport
headline.print_headline: Aching for Change in an Unequal Sport

docs.snippet: South America must keep its strong World Cup presence for the 2018 finals because it is a competitive region with the hardest qualifying programme, CONMEBOL president Juan Angel Napout said on Friday.

docs.snippet: More than 12 years after the Bush administration first sent detainees to the prison in Cuba, tensions are mounting over whether President Obama can close it before leaving office.
docs.lead_paragraph: More than 12 years after the Bush administration first sent detainees to the prison in Cuba, tensions are mounting over whether President Obama can close it before leaving office.
docs.abstract: Tensions are mounting over whether Pres Obama can keep campaign pledge to close military prison at Guantanamo Bay Naval Base in Cuba, even as structure decays and inmates age; government is bracing for a wave of new habeas corpus lawsuits after American combat operations in Afghanistan come to an end in December, raising issue of whether legal basis for wartime detentions at Guantanamo Bay has expired.

keywords.value: United States Defense and Military Forces

docs.snippet: Brazil and Colombia, the dust barely settled following their brutal World Cup quarter-final, clash again and there will also be a replay of the final as Germany host Argentina in this week's international friendlies.
